meanings.definition: To lift or raise by pushing from behind or below.
meanings.sent1: She used her legs to boost herself onto the chair.
meanings.sent2: The new training program will boost our performance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to boost the toy mouse up the stairs.
meanings.sent4: His encouraging words were like a boost of energy for her spirit.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape seemed to boost him higher into the sky.

meanings.sent1: Eating healthy foods can boost your overall health.
meanings.sent2: The company hopes the new marketing campaign will boost sales.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion promised to boost his intelligence overnight.
meanings.sent4: Her smile never failed to boost the mood of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The sunshine seemed to boost the colors of the flowers in the garden.

meanings.definition: A push from behind or below.
meanings.sent1: With a boost from his friends, he managed to climb over the wall.
meanings.sent2: The rocket engines provided the necessary boost for liftoff.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel gave a playful boost to the acorn.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected compliment felt like a boost to her confidence.
meanings.sent5: The wind gave an extra boost to the kite, making it soar higher.
